pullRequest.title: [BEAM-9446] Retain unknown arguments when using uber jar job server.
pullRequest.bodyText:
See #11052 for context.

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message: [BEAM-9446] Retain unknown arguments when using uber jar job server.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -285,10 +289,25 @@ def get_all_options(
       cls._add_argparse_args(parser)  # pylint: disable=protected-access
     if add_extra_args_fn:
       add_extra_args_fn(parser)
+
     known_args, unknown_args = parser.parse_known_args(self._flags)
-    if unknown_args:
-      _LOGGER.warning("Discarding unparseable args: %s", unknown_args)
-    result = vars(known_args)
+    if retain_unknown_options:
+      i = 0
+      while i < len(unknown_args):
+        # Treat all unary flags as booleans, and all binary argument values as
+        # strings.
+        if i + 1 >= len(unknown_args) or unknown_args[i + 1].startswith('--'):
+          parser.add_argument(unknown_args[i], action='store_true')
+          i += 1
+        else:
+          parser.add_argument(unknown_args[i], type=str)
+          i += 2

nodes.bodyText: Should we always check a parameter name starts with --, like done here for boolean flags?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -285,10 +289,25 @@ def get_all_options(
       cls._add_argparse_args(parser)  # pylint: disable=protected-access
     if add_extra_args_fn:
       add_extra_args_fn(parser)
+
     known_args, unknown_args = parser.parse_known_args(self._flags)
-    if unknown_args:
-      _LOGGER.warning("Discarding unparseable args: %s", unknown_args)
-    result = vars(known_args)
+    if retain_unknown_options:
+      i = 0
+      while i < len(unknown_args):
+        # Treat all unary flags as booleans, and all binary argument values as
+        # strings.
+        if i + 1 >= len(unknown_args) or unknown_args[i + 1].startswith('--'):

nodes.bodyText:
Why rsplit? Shouldn't this be:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      split = unknown_args[i].rsplit('=')
          
          
            
                      split = unknown_args[i].split('=', 1)
          
      
    
    
  

?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -285,10 +289,29 @@ def get_all_options(
       cls._add_argparse_args(parser)  # pylint: disable=protected-access
     if add_extra_args_fn:
       add_extra_args_fn(parser)
+
     known_args, unknown_args = parser.parse_known_args(self._flags)
-    if unknown_args:
-      _LOGGER.warning("Discarding unparseable args: %s", unknown_args)
-    result = vars(known_args)
+    if retain_unknown_options:
+      i = 0
+      while i < len(unknown_args):
+        # Treat all unary flags as booleans, and all binary argument values as
+        # strings.
+        if i + 1 >= len(unknown_args) or unknown_args[i + 1].startswith('-'):
+          split = unknown_args[i].rsplit('=')

nodes.bodyText: Otherwise this will break options like experiments=state_cache_size=1.
nodes.diffHunk:

       cls._add_argparse_args(parser)  # pylint: disable=protected-access
     if add_extra_args_fn:
       add_extra_args_fn(parser)
+

-    if unknown_args:

-    result = vars(known_args)
+    if retain_unknown_options:
+      i = 0
+      while i < len(unknown_args):
+        # Treat all unary flags as booleans, and all binary argument values as
+        # strings.
+        if i + 1 >= len(unknown_args) or unknown_args[i + 1].startswith('-'):
+          split = unknown_args[i].rsplit('=')

commit.message:
Use split instead of rsplit

Co-Authored-By: Maximilian Michels <mxm@apache.org>
